page.title: 17TRANSPORT IN PENCOED
page.content: Roads to-day are the most important means of transport in Britain and Pencoed is very near one of the motorways linking all the country. The M4 runs alongside Pencoed and this is the motorway that joins South Wales with London. Junction 35 is west of our area with the motorway running to Junction 36 which is north of Coity. The main road through Pencoed is quieter since the opening of a by-pass which joins the motorway. Railways are another important means of transport and the main London to Fishguard line runs through the centre of Pencoed. The old railway station has been closed and there are several delays at the crossing gates now that the footbridge has been taken down.
